alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Western Clay; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 3:41PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Bradford, east central Alachua, northwestern Putnam and southwestern Clay Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 341 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Orange Heights, or near Melrose, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Keystone Heights, Melrose, Melrose Landing, George`s Lake, Orange Heights, Kingsley, Lake Geneva, Florahome, Camp Blanding and Waldo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern and northeastern Florida.

area.areaDesc: Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Western Clay; Western Putnam
